Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2013 02:33PM alaskanabbott wrote: This is all really good info! I cancelled my appt with the local general surgeon. There IS a BS, in Anchorage which is about 3 hours away, BUT our insurance wouldn't cover the general surgeon or the BS so I decided just in case I get hinky results I might as well only see one specialist. Also insurance said they won't cover the diagnostic mammo or ultrasound- which makes it REALLY hard to want to go do them. In my gut I know I'm fine, so paying just to find out I'm fine seems so awful! Then again if it does come back "something" it's worth every penny. I'm starting to think this situation sucks! I have a notepad, I love the idea of keeping it all together. I'm going to make sure to ask the radiologist who will call so I know who to bug :) I don't want to dig any deeper into "what-ifs", I think truely this is simply a weird thing going on and NOT cancer. I've read that inverted nipples can be lots of things, even just getting older. Plus I nursed 6 kids with those babies- they gotta be tired! So no reason to freak myself out. I do like knowing what steps I need to take right now, and let tomorrows worries happen tomorrow, you know? So mammo is scheduled for Oct 1st- I can post an update after. Any other advise you think I need is welcome.
Posts.Title: Fibrous breasts, lump, inverted nipple, confused not worried alaskanabbott AlaskaAngel

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2013 12:51PM alaskanabbott wrote: pre-lim report: Our local radiologist submitted his report- but the official report comes from another DR in Washington who also reads the MRI. I'm not sure if she will "see" anything different. Findings: there is moderate background parenchymal enhancement. Right nipple is noted to be retracted. There is a mild degree of enhancement seen associated with this nipple. The pattern of enhancement is a plateau pattern. No associated mass is seen. Non-Enhancing T2 hyper-intense cysts are noted in the right breast. Impression: Retracted nipple is observed without abnormal enhancement. No masses or abnormal enhancements can be seen. Sounds good right?
Posts.Title: Fibrous breasts, lump, inverted nipple, confused not worried alaskanabbott AlaskaAngel

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2013 06:44PM alaskanabbott wrote: Talked to the gen surgeon Friday. Here's the update, which is pretty much me in the exact same boat: Type 2 plateau patterns on an MRI are cancerous indications between 10-80 percent of the time. The plateau pattern was right under the nipple, and that is where my issues seem to be. The other breast was fine and had type 1 patterns. I was only given a Birads 2. My gen surgeon said that since no mass/tumors were seen that I am ok to do 6 month follow ups. I was very happy with this info, until today, when I am starting to wonder if I am making the right decision by just sitting back and waiting- which feels an awful lot like just waiting for cancer. At this point I could make an appointment with the breast surgeon in Anchorage and get a 2nd opinion or just be happy that everything looks...well it doesn't look good and it doesn't look bad, it just looks. Anyone want to help me out here with some wise council?
Posts.Title: Fibrous breasts, lump, inverted nipple, confused not worried alaskanabbott AlaskaAngel
